Join the Clean Energy Revolution

Become a Power System Application Engineer 3 at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you will work with a team to develop and implement critical Real-Time Power System Applications, and work with vendors to resolve application issues. You will maintain existing Remedial Action Schemes (RAS) and develop new expansion projects using C, C++, and C#.   

Additionally, you’ll:

Assist in developing, testing, deploying, and maintaining Real-Time Remedial Action Scheme (RAS) applications on Energy Management System (EMS) and Unified Analytic Platform (UAP) on Centralize Remedial Action Scheme (CRAS).  
Perform tier 3 support on sophisticated technical issues associated with Real-Time RAS applications. 

As a Power System Application Engineer 3, your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future? 

Responsibilities
Ensures technical issues and problems are resolved in a timely, efficient and cost-effective manner utilizing available resources
Supervises, leads, and coordinates work with full time and contract employees in the execution of new technical strategies, equipment or standards.
Conducts life cycle assessments for utility infrastructure materials and processes; improves preventive maintenance procedures to decrease overall downtime
Conducts risk assessments and implements risk mitigation strategies to ensure the safety and reliability of engineering projects
Supports audits and inspections; ensures compliance with relevant environmental, health, and safety regulations
Provides engineering and technical expertise and guidance for the identification, analysis and resolution of high impact, complex and/or cross-functional problems in engineering
Ensures the engineering facility design basis is controlled and design basis documentation is maintained
Conducts engineering and related studies with full technical responsibility for planning and coordinating high-impact complex projects
Provides support and technical training to junior engineering levels
A material job duty of all positions within the Company is ensuring the protection of all its physical, financial and cybersecurity assets, and properly accessing and managing private customer data, proprietary information, confidential medical records, and other types of highly sensitive information and data with the highest standards of conduct and integrity.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Bachelor’s Degree in a scientific/technical/math field.
Five or more years of experience performing engineering work in operations, production, construction or maintenance environments.
Possess a valid Class C Driver’s License.

Preferred Qualifications

Three or more years of experience in developing and maintaining complex programs using C, C++, or C#. 
Experience troubleshooting and resolving system technical issues. 
Experience and technical knowledge of SCADA and control systems. 
Solid understanding of infrastructure and networking capabilities to design highly resilient systems. 
Experience with Linux shell scripting. 
Experience with network traffic analysis. 
Experience with GOOSE (Generic Object Oriented Substation Event) protocol 

Additional Information 

This position’s work mode is hybrid. The employee will report to an SCE facility for a set number of days with the option to work remotely on the remaining days.  Unless otherwise noted, employees are required to work and reside in the state of California.  Further details of this work mode will be discussed at the interview stage. The work mode can be changed based on business needs.

You will support a diverse portfolio of use cases by working across the full data science lifecycle from problem discovery and data exploration through model development and deployment. You will apply strong technical and analytical skills in a pragmatic environment, where success depends on both modeling expertise and the ability to translate business problems into actionable and production-ready solutions. In addition to delivering individual use cases, you will also play a key part in evolving data science infrastructure, enhancing data science capabilities, building tools, and establishing best practices.

Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or Business Analytics.
Five or more years of experience in data analytics related work.*PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, business analytics = 2 years of experience credit.

Experience designing and delivering production-grade data science or AI/ML solutions, including conventional machine learning and deep learning approaches such as computer vision and large language models, applied to real-world operational and business problems.
Experience leading the end-to-end model development lifecycle, including problem formulation, method selection, data exploration, feature engineering, model training and evaluation, and deployment of production-ready solutions.
Hands-on experience working with diverse data types and formats, including tabular and time-series data, imagery, video, LiDAR or other spatial data, and unstructured text or audio recordings.

Ability to balance individual ownership with effective collaboration across cross-functional teams.

Become a PI System Senior Advisor (Architect) at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you’ll be responsible for providing hands-on, technical leadership within the Power Systems Controls (PSC) group for the PI System (historian).  This role should be a recognized expert in solving business problems with the PI System and related analytical technologies.  This position works with other team members and business clients to solve business problems through innovative solutions as we modernize the electrical grid through smart grid technologies.   

This role ensures that the PI System is designed and maintained in a way to ensure reliability, performance, integration and scalability of the platform.  This includes evaluating new data sources for history management, analytics tools to gain insight from results analyses toward solving business problems and specifying and implementing integration patterns to operationalize results to other systems (e.g. SAP, EMS, DERMS, etc.).  This role also ensures that the PI System is maintained at optimized component versions and evaluates the system and vendor changes to ensure cyber security is maintained.  In addition, this role develops technology roadmaps for the PI System platform and its integration with other systems, while planning for its future.   

The PI System advisor works collaboratively with other technology architects, corporate business teams and other technical contributors or project sponsors. The advisor also leads the design and support of PI System compliance within our regulated NERC CIP environment.  The PI System advisor will collect requirements, prepare designs and implement solutions to the business using the PI System and related analytics technologies using modern, agile techniques for development.  These solutions may include tailoring of the PI System analytics, development of custom or extensions to the PI System using modern technology languages, frameworks and patterns.  

The PI System Senior Advisor should be an experienced engineer who supports the historian’s architecture, maintenance and enhancements. This position will support the PI System maintenance team and provide technical leadership and guidance for troubling or recurring maintenance issues when they arise. 

As a PI System Senior Advisor, your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future?
